mstdlib LOCAL mstdlib

NAME

mjo_search_binary — Perform a binary search on an array that is sorted in ascending order

SYNOPSIS

#include <mstdlib.h>

void
mjo_search_binary(int *const o_found, size_t * const o_slot, void const * i_array, size_t const i_object_size, size_t const i_slots, void (*i_compare)(int *const, void const *, void const *), void const *const i_object_to_find);

DESCRIPTION

mjo_search_binary() shall perform a binary search on an array (i_array) that is sorted in ascending order looking for the object i_object_to_find.

Following is a description of the arguments.

o_found
pointer to an ‘int’ (boolean) that shall be set to indicate whether or not the object was found
o_slot
pointer to a ‘size_t’ that shall be set to the index of where the object was found or where it can be inserted
i_array
array of objects to search
i_object_size
size of an object
i_slots
count of objects in the array
i_compare
compare routine
i_object_to_find
object to find in the array

If o_found is nil, it shall not be set.

If o_slot is nil, it shall not be set.

If i_array or the function pointer i_compare is nil or if i_object_size or i_slots is zero, *o_found shall be set to false and *o_slot shall be set to zero.

If the object i_obj_to_find is found in the array, *o_found shall be set to true and *o_slot shall be set to the index position of the object.

If the object is not found in the array, *o_found shall be set to false and *o_slot shall be set to the insertion point.

NOTES

i_array must have no less than i_slots elements.

i_array elements shall be homogeneous. Objects shall have an exact data structure layout and must be i_object_size octets in length.

The function pointer i_compare shall compare two objects and return a comparison status indicator of whether the first object is equal to, less than or greater than the second object.

If the first object (object to compare) is equal to the second object (i_object_to_find), i_compare shall return zero.

If the first object (object to compare) is less than the second object (i_object_to_find), i_compare shall return a negative number.

If the first object (object to compare) is greater then the second object (i_object_to_find), i_compare shall return a positive number.

July 22, 2020 OpenBSD 7.0
